titleInfo.title: Letter, William A. Huddard in Knoxville, Tenn. to his father in Ohio, 1863 December 13

mods.abstract: In this letter, dated December 13, 1863, William A. Huddard in Knoxville, Tenn., writes to his father in Ohio, discussing their march from Chattanooga to Knoxville. He also describes Knoxville as being "at one time a splendid place, but now it is pretty well run down." In addition, he informs his father of the pro-Union disposition of many of the East Tennesseeans: "In some counties we passed through you could not find a single rebel; all were for the Union."
